issue.title: Getting error "System.InvalidOperationException: Cannot scaffold C# literals of type 'System.Reflection.NullabilityInfoContext" in EF Core 8.0.4/8.0.8

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
## I am getting scaffold related error while creating migration file in EF Core. 

Below add migration script trying in dot net tool and throws below error.
 `dotnet ef --startup-project . migrations add 20240917_add_column`

### Include stack traces

```
System.InvalidOperationException: Cannot scaffold C# literals of type 'System.Reflection.NullabilityInfoContext'. The provider should implement CoreTypeMapping.GenerateCodeLiteral to support using it at design time.
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.Internal.CSharpHelper.UnknownLiteral(Object value)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.Internal.CSharpHelper.<Fragment>g__AppendMethodCall|55_0(IMethodCallCodeFragment current, <>c__DisplayClass55_0&)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.Internal.CSharpHelper.Fragment(IMethodCallCodeFragment fragment, Int32 indent)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.Design.CSharpSnapshotGenerator.GenerateAnnotations(String builderName, IAnnotatable annotatable, IndentedStringBuilder stringBuilder, Dictionary`2 annotations, Boolean inChainedCall, Boolean leadingNewline, MethodInfo hasAnnotationMethodInfo)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.Design.CSharpSnapshotGenerator.Generate(String modelBuilderName, IModel model, IndentedStringBuilder stringBuilder)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.Design.CSharpMigrationsGenerator.GenerateMetadata(String migrationNamespace, Type contextType, String migrationName, String migrationId, IModel targetModel)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.Design.MigrationsScaffolder.ScaffoldMigration(String migrationName, String rootNamespace, String subNamespace, String language)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.Internal.MigrationsOperations.AddMigration(String name, String outputDir, String contextType, String namespace)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.OperationExecutor.AddMigrationImpl(String name, String outputDir, String contextType, String namespace)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.OperationExecutor.AddMigration.<>c__DisplayClass0_0.<.ctor>b__0()
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.OperationExecutor.OperationBase.<>c__DisplayClass3_0`1.<Execute>b__0()
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.OperationExecutor.OperationBase.Execute(Action action)
Cannot scaffold C# literals of type 'System.Reflection.NullabilityInfoContext'. The provider should implement CoreTypeMapping.GenerateCodeLiteral to support using it at design time.
```

### Include provider and version information

EF Core version:
Database provider: (e.g. Npgsql.EntityFrameworkCore.PostgreSQL 8.0.4) 
Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design 8.0.8 also tried with 8.0.4
Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Proxies 8.0.8 also tried with 8.0.4 
Target framework: (e.g. .NET 8.0)
Operating system:
IDE: (Visual Studio 2022 17.8.4)

Any help really appreciated. Thanks!

issue.title: Move NonNullableConventionState to CoreAnnotationNames

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
This means it gets correctly filtered out when using the model for code generation, and hence we don't try to generate a literal for it.

Fixes #34996

issue.title: Migration fails in EF7 when mapping TVF using a model with 'string' properties

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Issues that have been approved but are not scheduled a specific release.

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

body:
@ajcvickers Why do we do the things that we do? A long time ago I saw a video where you discussed/explained this 'defensive copy' pattern. I liked that. A lot, because I think we need to make it as difficult as possible for ourselves to  unintentionally make mistakes. So I use IReadOnlyCollection<T> properties with a backing field of List<T> everywhere.

SInce I like my code to be predictable for future me or new readers, that means I use IReadOnlyCollection\<string\> as well. Just to have no surprises for readers/reviewers.

I guess the same applies to the model configuration. Just predictably repeated configuration for all the collections. And to be honest, I also was not aware of .PrimitiveCollection(x => x.property). Even after reading your comment it took some effort to find it!

I was able to get it working using a workaround like

```c#
        builder.Property(x => x.Uids).HasField("_uids")
            .HasConversion(
                v => JsonConvert.SerializeObject(v, (JsonSerializerSettings?)null),
                v => JsonConvert.DeserializeObject<List<string>>(v, (JsonSerializerSettings?)null)!,
                ReadOnlyCollectionValueComparer<string>.Create());
```

but my extensive reading of the online documentation (age will teach a person that reading documentation is a GOOD thing) had me convinced that the original code should work. In addition, the create and drop apis do work as intended, it is just that I can't create a migration (bundle).

issue.title: System.InvalidOperationException: Cannot scaffold C# literals of type 'System.Reflection.NullabilityInfoContext' during migration

repository.name: efcore.pg
repository.description: Entity Framework Core provider for PostgreSQL

issue.body:
When attempting to create a new migration in my project using Entity Framework Core, I encountered the following error:


```System.InvalidOperationException: Cannot scaffold C# literals of type 'System.Reflection.NullabilityInfoContext'. The provider should implement CoreTypeMapping.GenerateCodeLiteral to support using it at design time.
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.Internal.CSharpHelper.UnknownLiteral(Object value)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.Internal.CSharpHelper.<Fragment>g__AppendMethodCall|57_0(IMethodCallCodeFragment current, <>c__DisplayClass57_0&)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.Internal.CSharpHelper.Fragment(IMethodCallCodeFragment fragment, Int32 indent)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.Design.CSharpSnapshotGenerator.GenerateAnnotations(String builderName, IAnnotatable annotatable, IndentedStringBuilder stringBuilder, Dictionary`2 annotations, Boolean inChainedCall, Boolean leadingNewline, MethodInfo hasAnnotationMethodInfo)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.Design.CSharpSnapshotGenerator.Generate(String modelBuilderName, IModel model, IndentedStringBuilder stringBuilder)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.Design.CSharpMigrationsGenerator.GenerateMetadata(String migrationNamespace, Type contextType, String migrationName, String migrationId, IModel targetModel)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Migrations.Design.MigrationsScaffolder.ScaffoldMigration(String migrationName, String rootNamespace, String subNamespace, String language, Boolean dryRun)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.Internal.MigrationsOperations.AddMigration(String name, String outputDir, String contextType, String namespace, Boolean dryRun)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.OperationExecutor.AddMigrationImpl(String name, String outputDir, String contextType, String namespace, Boolean dryRun)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.OperationExecutor.AddMigration.<>c__DisplayClass0_0.<.ctor>b__0()
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.OperationExecutor.OperationBase.<>c__DisplayClass3_0`1.<Execute>b__0()
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design.OperationExecutor.OperationBase.Execute(Action action)
Cannot scaffold C# literals of type 'System.Reflection.NullabilityInfoContext'. The provider should implement CoreTypeMapping.GenerateCodeLiteral to support using it at design time.
```


Expected Behavior:
The migration should scaffold without errors, as it did in .NET 8.

Actual Behavior:
The process fails with the above error after upgrading to .NET 9.

Additional Context:
the migration process worked without issues in .NET 8 but fails in .NET 9.

I attempted to use the --verbose flag to obtain more detailed logs, but it did not provide additional meaningful information.

rename.from: public IReadOnlyCollection<string> with private backing field throws exception when trying to add migration
rename.to: ReadOnlyCollection<string> with private backing field throws exception on NullabilityInfoContext when trying to add migration

body: Also reported in https://github.com/npgsql/efcore.pg/issues/3386, and multiple users in #34698... Reopening to consider for patching.
